intro: Hypolaena tenuis, commonly known as the slender hypolaena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
